title: Low and high orders light scattering in particulate media

references.title: The Monte Carlo Method
references.raw: I.M. Sobol’, The Monte Carlo Method (The University of Chicago Press, Chicago, 1974).

abstract:
We present the results of a theoretical study providing details of propagation
of laser radiation within disperse randomly inhomogeneous intermediately single-
to-multiple scattering media. A quantitative analysis of scattering orders in
the transition from single to multiple scattering is presented. Crossed source-
detector fiber optics geometry used to separate the intensity of single
scattering from higher scattering orders. The results demonstrate good agreement
between analytical and Monte Carlo techniques. This validates the use of the
Monte Carlo approach in the intermediate single-to-multiple scattering regime.
The method used can be applied to verify analytical results against experiment
via the Monte Carlo calculations that include imperfections of the experiment
